required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Dysphagia Using the Mendelsohn Maneuver
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Dysphagia Using the Mendelsohn Maneuver

collaborator.agency: National Institute on Deafness and Other Communication Disorders (NIDCD)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary goal of the investigation is to determine the effects of the Mendelsohn maneuver on the physiology of the swallow in individuals who have suffered a stroke and exhibit signs of pharyngeal dysphagia.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary goal of the investigation is to determine the effects of the Mendelsohn maneuver (voluntary prolongation of laryngeal excursion at the midpoint of the swallow) on the physiology of the swallow in individuals who have suffered a stroke and exhibit signs of pharyngeal dysphagia (specifically, reduced duration of hyoid maximum elevation, reduced extent of hyoid maximum elevation, reduced duration of hyoid maximum anterior excursion, reduced extent of hyoid maximum anterior excursion, and reduced duration of upper esophageal sphincter (UES) opening with subsequent residue in the pyriform sinuses and, potentially, aspiration). Participants are assessed with videofluoroscopy at the initiation of the study and after each week of the study. After the 4 weeks of participation are complete, all participants will be discharged from treatment and will be brought back to the clinic for a final Videofluoroscopic Swallow Study (VFSS) evaluation after 2 weeks. This means that individuals in Group 1 will be re-analyzed after 1 month of additional no-treatment, and Group 2 will be re-analyzed after 2 additional weeks of no-treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Duration of Superior Hyolaryngeal Movement
primary_outcome.description: Change in duration of superior elevation of hyoid bone.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Duration of Hyoid Maximum Anterior Excursion
primary_outcome.description: Change in the duration of maximum anterior movement of the hyoid bone during swallowing.

secondary_outcome.description: Oral Intake Ability was measure with the Dysphagia Outcome and Severity Scale. A 7 is normal and a 1 is complete inability to consume any food safely. The means reported for treatment and no treatment periods are mean changes in scores throughout the period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Duration of Opening of Upper Esophageal Sphincter
secondary_outcome.description: Change in duration of pre- and post-treatment duration of UES opening.

arm_group.description: Within subject, treatment and no-treatment periods. Each participant served as his/her own control in this AABB/BBAA alternating treatment conditions design. Results were also compared across groups (treatment v. no-treatment).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Stroke (1-18 months post)
- Pharyngeal Dysphagia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other neurologic or structural abnormality to oropharynx
- History of dysphagia prior to latest stroke

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Recruitment of participants occurred through The University of Arkansas for Medical Sciences Medical Center Speech Pathology Clinic and newspaper advertisements between February 2003 and February 2010.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants were only assigned to a group after their initial evaluation and no exclusions were necessary. Participants were each assigned to receive 2 weeks of treatment and two weeks of no treatment. Assignments were randomized so half began with treatment and half began with no treatment.

group.title: No Treatment Then Treatment
group.description: Participants received 2 weeks of no-treatment and then 2 weeks of treatment with the Mendelsohn manuever.

group.title: Treatment Then No Treatment
group.description: Participants received 2 weeks of treatment with the Mendelsohn manuever and then 2 weeks of no treatment.

group.title: Entire Study Population
group.description: This includes all participants. Half received treatment then no treatment and have received no treatment then treatment.

measure.title: Age
measure.description: Participants were analyzed for age effects within analysis of variance.

measure.title: Sex: Female, Male
measure.description: Gender effects were analyzed within the analysis of variance.

reported_events.time_frame: Subjects were followed for up to one year after study completion.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
